cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts related to narrative explanations of unknown or supernatural phenomena across history, including the stories themselves and the broad historical periods in which they arose.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Origins of urban legends in ancient times when stories explained the unknown and supernatural.

members.entity_description: Narrative stories and tales, particularly urban legends, used historically to explain unknown and supernatural phenomena and reflecting societal fears and anxieties.
A distant historical period when early explanatory stories about the unknown were told.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts and distinctions between objective reality and invented story content, including facts, fiction, real events, and the blurred boundary between them within narratives.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The line between fact and fiction is often blurred... ponder the truth behind the stories

members.entity_description: The conceptual boundary distinguishing objective truth from invented or embellished narrative, often blurred in storytelling.
Information or events considered objectively true and verifiable.
Actual reality or factual basis underlying the stories being told.
Actual historical or factual occurrences that may underlie some stories.
Invented or imagined content within stories, contrasting with factual material.

splits.name: Narrative Explanations of the Unknown
splits.description: Stories and tales, particularly urban legends, used historically to explain unknown and supernatural phenomena and reflect societal fears.

splits.name: Historical Periods of Narrative Origins
splits.description: Historical periods (e.g., ancient times) referenced as the context in which explanatory stories about the unknown were told.

args.justification: ClsC_351d72f0 currently mixes two distinct kinds of entities—narrative content (stories and tales) and a temporal qualifier (ancient times)—so it should be split into a narrative-concept class and a time-period class for cleaner semantics.

args.new_description: Stories and tales, particularly urban legends, used historically to explain unknown and supernatural phenomena and reflect societal fears and anxieties.
args.justification: The narrative-focused split should explicitly sit in the same overarching group as fact/fiction distinctions, clarifying it as a narrative-concept class within the history/truth/fiction domain.

args.new_description: Historical periods (such as ancient times) that serve as the temporal context for early explanatory stories about the unknown and supernatural.
args.justification: The temporal-period split should be clearly labeled as a temporal qualifier but kept in the same Class_Group since it frames when narrative explanations of the unknown arose within the truth/fiction/history context.

args.new_description: Concepts and distinctions between objective reality and invented story content, including facts, fiction, real events, and the blurred boundary between them within narratives.
args.justification: Confirm and standardize the metadata for the fact/fiction class within the same Class_Group as the newly split narrative-history classes, reinforcing a coherent schema over narrative truth, fiction, and historical framing.

executed_decisions.justification: ClsC_351d72f0 currently mixes two distinct kinds of entities—narrative content (stories and tales) and a temporal qualifier (ancient times)—so it should be split into a narrative-concept class and a time-period class for cleaner semantics.

executed_decisions.justification: The narrative-focused split should explicitly sit in the same overarching group as fact/fiction distinctions, clarifying it as a narrative-concept class within the history/truth/fiction domain.

executed_decisions.justification: The temporal-period split should be clearly labeled as a temporal qualifier but kept in the same Class_Group since it frames when narrative explanations of the unknown arose within the truth/fiction/history context.

executed_decisions.new_description: Concepts and distinctions between objective reality and invented story content, including facts, fiction, real events, and the blurred boundary between them within narratives.
executed_decisions.justification: Confirm and standardize the metadata for the fact/fiction class within the same Class_Group as the newly split narrative-history classes, reinforcing a coherent schema over narrative truth, fiction, and historical framing.
